channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading at the client's site it was discovered that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of dabco NE300 (un2735) had released one cup of product near the bottom seam. The driver was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090590
item.description:
Report X-2023090590

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: was found in tote in the unload, box was wet, no leakage on floor, brought spill pads over just in case DescribePack: no holes just one loose cap caused it to leak up if had been properly sealed that wouldn't have happened. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: spill pads, secured in hazmat tote and taken to the back for further loosing too./

item.title: Report X-2023080008
item.description:
Report X-2023080008

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-29
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 003/KCI RECIEVED SHIPMENT ON TRAILER, MOVED TRAILER FROM ONE SIDE OF YARD TO THE OTHER AND PARKED IN FRONT OF DOCK ~DOOR 92. THEY QUICKLY REALIZED IT WAS LEAKING OUT OF THE TRAILER AND IT SMELLED. THE SPILL WAS IN THE YARD, IN THE ~DRAIN, ON THE MOBILE PLATFORM.
